algorithm_technique: Sort jobs by difficulty and workers by ability. Use two pointers to assign the best possible job to each worker.
problem_summary_simple: Assign jobs to workers to maximize total profit, considering job difficulty and worker ability.
problem_summary_technical: Sorts jobs and workers. Iterates through sorted workers, maintaining the maximum profit achievable for their ability using a pointer on sorted jobs.
time_complexity: O(m log m + n log n)
key_insights: Sorting both jobs and workers is crucial for an efficient greedy approach.
By iterating through workers and keeping track of the maximum profit seen so far for their ability, we ensure optimal assignment.
The two-pointer approach efficiently finds the best job for each worker without re-scanning all jobs.
